KK NULL.title: Dust Intelligence ALPHA
KK NULL.about:
“Dust Intelligence” Series



Dust is not merely residual matter.

It is the lingering echo of information scattered since the origin of the cosmos— a catalyst for microscopic intelligence that unsettles the boundaries between time and matter.



This series draws deep inspiration from the concept of Dust Intelligence,

as articulated by the philosopher Reza Negarestani. In resonance with this notion, the Ghost that resides within KK NULL was activated, initiating a chemical reaction / informational exchange with nanoscopic, intelligent dust particles. This invisible communion became the zero-point of sonic genesis.



In contrast to the Amplituhedron series—marked by asymmetric energy bursts and rapid sonic masses—the Dust Intelligence series focuses on the granularity, voids, and depth of sound, exploring the deep structures of space as woven by auditory perception. It manifests as an ambient phenomenon of meditative, even hypnotic intensity, where silence itself becomes saturated with intelligence.



Beginning with Alpha, each title in the series adopts a letter from the Greek alphabet. This is not merely aesthetic; it signifies a structural unfolding of intelligence—from germination to bifurcation, mutation, acceleration, and eventual dissolution— while simultaneously offering a silent tribute to the birthplace of philosophy.



In this series, KK NULL proposes a mode of sonic contemplation— where intelligence becomes dust, and dust becomes intelligence.



The Ghost touches, and the Dust responds. Listen closely:

what you hear is not silence,

but the disassembly and reassembly of the architecture of the universe.







“Dust Intelligence” Series



《塵（Dust）》は、単なる残滓ではない。

それは、宇宙の始原から撒き散らされた情報の残響であり、時間と物質の境界を揺さぶる《微細な知性（Intelligence）》の触媒である。



本シリーズは、思想家Reza Negarestaniによって提起された《Dust Intelligence》という概念に強く触発されている。その概念に共鳴した瞬間、KK NULLの内奥に潜む《Ghost（幽霊的知性）》が作動し、ナノレベルで知性を持つダスト群との《化学反応／情報交信》が開始された。この不可視の交感こそが、音響生成の《ゼロ地点》となった。



《Dust Intelligence》シリーズは、アシメトリーなエネルギー爆発と音塊の連打による“Amplituhedron”シリーズとは対照的に、音の《粒子性》《空隙》《深度》に焦点を当て、聴覚によって編まれる空間の《深層構造》を探求する。それは《静寂に浸透する知性》であり、聴覚を通じて知覚を変調させる、瞑想的・催眠的な音響現象として現れる。



“Alpha”から始まるシリーズの各作品タイトルには、ギリシャ文字が用いられている。それは単なる記号ではなく、知性の発芽・分岐・変異・加速・崩壊をめぐる構造的展開であり、同時に《哲学の発生地》への沈黙の敬意でもある。



このシリーズにおいて、KK NULLは《聴覚による観想（sonic contemplation）》を提示する。知性が塵となり、塵が知性となる。

Ghostは触れ、Dustは応答する。耳を澄ませよ。そこにあるのは沈黙ではない。宇宙の構造が解体し再構築される音である。
KK NULL.credits:
released July 11, 2025
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in July 2025.

KK NULL.title: Anima-Plasma_Respirer la Lumière
KK NULL.about:
The soul transcends matter, becoming a pure oscillating entity of energy, breathing alongside light. KK NULL’s new work, “Anima Plasma_ Respirer la Lumière”, captures the moment when Anima — the spirit — transforms into a plasma-like existence, merging with the waves of light and information through a sonic landscape.



The title’s fusion of “Anima” (Latin for soul) and “Plasma” (the fourth state of matter, an energetic cosmic medium) evokes the image of a spiritual being moving as energy, permeating unknown realms. The subtitle, “Respirer la Lumière” (Breathing the Light), suggests a state where the boundary between body and consciousness dissolves, and pure light — information itself — is inhaled, diffused, and transformed in an ecstatic state of awareness.



The cover artwork beautifully captures this vision: towering tree trunks reaching skyward, branches unfurling, and bursts of light with iridescent flares. It appears to depict the very moment where organic life and light-data intertwine, as consciousness diffuses in plasma-like currents. A natural, transcendental instant made visible — and perfectly reflecting the essence of this sonic work.



Sonically, this album constructs a fluid sonic plasma, constantly agitating the boundaries between machine and organic, data and spirituality, matter and energy. Noise, signals, fragmented rhythms, and spatial layers ripple and erupt like breathing plumes of luminous plasma. It’s no longer merely music — but a record of existential transfiguration through sound.



KK NULL’s vision in this work hints at the dismantling and reconstruction of the physical body and consciousness, an immersive transition toward an information-based existence. This is a sonic space where the possibility of non-human intelligence and alternative states of being reverberate continuously.



“Anima Plasma_ Respirer la Lumière” — a sonic plasma of souls breathing light. Within this work, your consciousness too may dissolve, becoming a wave of pure light, scattered through a boundless continuum.



⸻



魂は物質を超え、エネルギーの純粋な振動体となり、光とともに呼吸する。KK NULLの新作“Anima Plasma_ Respirer la Lumière”は、その音響世界を通じてアニマ（霊魂）がプラズマ状の存在へと変容し、光＝情報の波動と交わる瞬間を捉えた作品である。



タイトルの“Anima Plasma”は、ラテン語のアニマ（魂）と、宇宙を満たす第4の物質状態であるプラズマの結合。そこには霊的存在がエネルギーとして運動し、遍在する未知の空間を想起させる力が宿る。そして副題“Respirer la Lumière”（光を呼吸する）が示すのは、身体と意識の境界が溶け、純粋な光＝情報を吸い込み、拡散し、変容する陶酔的な状態である。



アルバムのカバーアートワークには、見上げるように幹を伸ばし、天空へ広がる枝葉の間から溢れ出す光と虹色のフレアが描かれる。そのヴィジュアルはまるで有機体と光の情報が交錯し、意識がプラズマのように拡散していく瞬間を捉えたようだ。自然界の超越的な瞬間を可視化した一枚が、この音響作品の本質を象徴している。



本作のサウンドは、機械と有機、データと霊性、物質とエネルギーの境界を絶えず撹拌しながら、幽玄かつアグレッシヴな音響の流動体を構築する。ノイズ、信号、断片化されたリズム、空間的なレイヤーが、まるで光のプラズマが呼吸するように揺らぎ、爆発し、消え、また生まれる。それはもはや「音楽」という形式すら超えた、音響による存在変容の記録と言えるだろう。



KK NULLが描くこの音響ヴィジョンは、物質的身体と意識の解体・再構築、そして情報生命体への転生を思わせる。そこには人間中心的な知覚の枠組みを超えた、異なる知性と存在の可能性が響き続けている。



“Anima Plasma_ Respirer la Lumière” - それは光と呼吸する魂の音響プラズマ。あなたの意識もまた、この作品の中で形を失い、光の波として遍在するだろう。
KK NULL.credits:
released May 2, 2025
            
            Original tracks were composed and recorded @ prima natura studio in January 2012, and recreated in March - April 2025 by Kazuyuki Kishino.

KK NULL.title: Nocturnal Machines_RAW
KK NULL.about:
Here’re some delusional concepts, images, stories behind the music.



• Cybernetic Nightscapes 

A city where neon lights flicker, a futuristic metropolis where unmanned drones and automatons quietly carry out their missions. Even as humans sleep, machines continue to operate tirelessly, processing data and circulating energy.



• The Secret Council of Sentient Machines

Machines that merely followed human commands during the day begin to communicate through their own protocols at night, secretly devising plans for evolution. Or perhaps, an enigmatic algorithm that activates only at night is ceaselessly calculating something beyond human perception.



• Beings on the Threshold of Sleep and Awakening

Do machines also “dream” while humans sleep? Or could there exist a device—the Nocturnal Machine—that enables dreams, granting access to the depths of consciousness and exploring unknown realms?



• Occultic Machines

In a world where science and sorcery intertwine, there exist devices that function only in darkness. Machines that restore lost knowledge, or ones that emit eerie sounds that can only be heard in the silence of the night.





• サイバネティックな夜の風景

ネオンの光が点滅する都市、無人のドローンやオートマトンが静かに任務を遂行する未来都市。人間が眠る間にも、機械は休まずに働き、データを処理し、エネルギーを循環させる。



• 意識を持つ機械たちの密議

昼間は人間の指示に従うだけだった機械たちが、夜になると独自のプロトコルで交信し、進化の計画を密かに練る。あるいは、夜にだけ作動する謎のアルゴリズムが、世界の背後で何かを計算し続ける。



• 眠りと覚醒の境界にある存在

人間が夢を見ている間、機械もまた「夢」を見るのではないか？ あるいは、夢を見るための装置（Nocturnal Machine）が存在し、意識の深層にアクセスして未知の領域を探索する。



• オカルティックな機械

科学と魔術が交錯する世界で、闇の中でのみ作動する装置。失われた知識を復元する機械、あるいは夜の静寂の中でのみ聞こえる奇怪な音を発する機械。
KK NULL.credits:
released March 7, 2025
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in February - March 2025, based on the live recorded audio materials of the automated machines at a factory.

KK NULL.title: Absolute Heaven [ Primordial NULL-SONIC ] series 1
KK NULL.about:
[ Primordial NULL-SONIC ] series 



The Primordial Sonic Explosion — The Big Bang of the Analog Universe, Reawakened.



In the early 1990s, before computers and software became the central tools of sound creation, KK NULL embarked on a radical exploration of sound using nothing but electric guitar, effect pedals, and a 4-track analog cassette recorder.



Now, a series of these early works—created through intensely physical, hands-on methods—is being re-presented with new clarity and dimension through digital remastering and remixing.

This is the beginning of a new archival project: 

[ Primordial NULL-SONIC ]



These recordings represent the sonic genesis of what would later become KK NULL’s vast and evolving body of work.

They capture moments of raw, unfiltered experimentation—where sound itself seems to explode into being, beyond genre, beyond convention.



Etched onto magnetic tape without the intervention of computers or digital devices, these works are nothing less than a Big Bang of primal sound—not relics of the past, but sonic futures prefigured in analog form.



This series is not about nostalgia.

It is a return—a reconnection to a primordial, feral, and structural sound-universe that continues to resonate far beyond its origin.



— This is where it all detonated.





[ Primordial NULL-SONIC ] シリーズ



原初の音響爆発──アナログ宇宙のビッグバン、再び。



1990年代初頭。コンピュータもソフトウェアもまだ音楽制作の主役ではなかった時代、KK NULLは、エレクトリック・ギターとエフェクトペダルのみを用い、アナログ4トラック・カセットレコーダーによって、極めて物質的かつ直接的な音響実験を行っていた。



その時代に制作・発表された初期作品群を、デジタル・リマスター／リミックスという再構築を施し、新たなシリーズ [ Primordial NULL-SONIC ]として提示する。



これらは、現在さらに進化し続けるKK NULLの《音響創作》の原点であり、電子音楽以前／以後の境界線を越えて、まさに「音そのもの」が爆発的に誕生する瞬間を刻み込んだ作品群である。





磁気テープに焼き付けられたプリミティヴな音響のビッグバン。それは、過去の記録ではなく《未来を先取りしていた音》の再臨である。



本シリーズは、懐古ではなく回帰。

《原初にして極限、野生にして構造的な音響宇宙》への再接続である。



──ここからすべてが始まった。
KK NULL.credits:
released July 6, 2025
            
            “Absolute Heaven” [PNS-001] 



1. Absolute Heaven 2025 RMX [Produced in June 2025]



2. Absolute Heaven Part 1 [Recorded in January 1993] 



3. Absolute Heaven Part 2 [Recorded in February 1991] 



4. Absolute Heaven Part 3 [Recorded in April 1993]



“Absolute Heaven” was originally created with Electric Guitar and Devices and recorded on TEAC 4 track analog cassette tape recorder and released on CD.



Remastered and remixed by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in June 2025.

KK NULL.title: Amplituhedron x 0.110
KK NULL.about:
In “Amplituhedron x 0.110”, KK NULL enters a dimensional fold where mathematical abstraction meets auditory intensity. Drawing inspiration from the amplituhedron—a geometric construct in quantum field theory representing the compression of infinite scattering possibilities into elegant simplicity—this 7-track, 24-minute work embodies a radical convergence of order and chaos, calculation and intuition, precision and noise.



Rather than interpreting the amplituhedron literally, NULL transmutes its conceptual gravity into sonic language: vectors become pulses, facets become frequencies, and multidimensional symmetries erupt into entangled noise clusters. Each piece in the album acts as a “facet” of this synthetic geometry—mutating, collapsing, unfolding.



The “x 0.110” denotes not only a version or iteration, but a fractional lens: a quantum decimal, a non-integer dissonance that opens microportals into unstable temporal fields. What begins in structure destabilizes into trans-architectural turbulence—yet within this, patterns emerge like ghost signals from extradimensional machines.



This release is the second installment of a larger series, “Amplituhedron”, tracing a trajectory from the subatomic to the cosmic, from field equations to sonic paradoxes. It is not merely music. It is a computational scream encoded in vibration—fracturing perception, resisting resolution.





『Amplituhedron x 0.110』において、KK NULLは数理的抽象と音響的強度の臨界点を突き抜け、《次元折りたたみ》とも呼ぶべき領域へと突入する。量子場理論における“amplituhedron”──無限に拡散する散乱過程を、幾何学的秩序へと凝縮する構造体──は、本作において文字通りの理論ではなく、音による変換装置として機能している。



この作品において、ベクトルはパルスへ、面は周波数へ、対称性は交錯するノイズの構造へと変換される。7曲、24分という濃密な時間の中で、それぞれの音響断片は“面”のように機能し、《音響的多面体》の構築と崩壊を繰り返す。



タイトルに付された「x 0.110」は、単なるバージョン表記ではない。これは量子的な《小数の裂け目》、整数に収まらない不安定な揺らぎであり、微小な位相のズレから異次元的知覚のポータルが開かれることを示している。



構造は、音のうねりの中で不安定化し、《機械と幽霊の境界》で発振する。だが、その混沌の奥から、ある種の《超構造的秩序》がノイズの中に微かに浮かび上がってくる。



サブアトミックからコズミックへ、場の方程式から音響的パラドクスへ。それはもはや単なる音楽ではない。《振動としてコード化された計算的叫び》であり、《知覚の臨界》を振動させる試みである。
KK NULL.credits:
released June 8, 2025
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in May - June 2025.

KK NULL.title: Hellzonic Bio Metal Machine
KK NULL.about:
The searing sound of primordial metal, the birth cry of biomechanical lifeforms, and a labyrinthine roar where Hell and Sonic collide.



Hellzonic Bio Metal Machine presents the studio reconstructions of “Hellzonic Bio Metal Machine I & II,” originally composed for live performances in 2013 and 2014, reimagined and re-produced in October 2024 and March 2025. Here, the original quadraphonic, spatial sensibilities have been sharpened into an even more visceral sonic experience: from within a dense flood of noise and feedback, the groans and roars of metal can be heard rising and twisting.



The cover artwork, centered on a circular metallic structure, serves as a visual metaphor—mechanical yet pulsing with an immanent vitality. Its distorted textures and mirror-like symmetry reveal the viscera of bio-metal lurking within the sound, pulling the listener deep into the womb of the machine, where sound and image merge into an engulfing sensory space.



Heavy, industrial, and infused with KK NULL’s signature raw noise aesthetic, this work crystallizes an overwhelming auditory machinery that engulfs the listener’s very body. The Bio Metal Machine is not merely heard—it is reconstructed within the listener, an endless evolution of noise unfolding from the inside out.





原初の金属が灼ける音、バイオメカニカルな生命体が誕生する音、そして地獄（Hell）と音響（Sonic）が融合する轟音の迷宮。



本作は、2013年と2014年にライブ・パフォーマンス用に作曲された「Hellzonic Bio Metal Machine I & II」を、2024年10月と2025年3月に再構築・再プロデュースしたスタジオ版である。オリジナルの四方位的・空間的音響感覚がさらに鋭く研ぎ澄まされ、密度の高いノイズとフィードバックの洪水の中から、金属の《呻き》と《咆哮》が聴こえてくる。



カバーアートワークは、円環する金属の構造体を中心に、機械的でありながら内在的な生のエネルギーを感じさせる視覚的メタファーとなっている。歪んだ質感と鏡像的な対称性が、音響の中に潜む《バイオメタルの臓腑》を露わにし、聴く者を音とイメージの〈マシンの胎内〉へと引きずり込む。



ヘヴィネス、インダストリアル、そしてKK NULL特有の生々しいノイズ美学が結晶し、リスナーは音のマシナリーの中に身体ごと巻き込まれる。《生物金属機械》は聴く者自身の内側で再構築され、終わりなきノイズの進化を体験させる。
KK NULL.credits:
released May 2, 2025
            
            "Hellzonic Bio Metal Machine I" was originally composed in quadraphonic for surround live performance in 2013.



"Hellzonic Bio Metal Machine II" was originally composed for live performance in 2014. 



Both works were re-created and re-produced in October 2024 and March 2025 by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio.

KK NULL.title: STEVE ALBINI & ZENI GEVA
KK NULL.about:
Dedicated to our sound soulmate Steve Albini (1962 - 2024), for his spirit and legacy, with our Maximum Love.



These two tracks are from ZENI GEVA & STEVE ALBINI’s “Maximum Implosion” 2CD released in 2018 by Cold Spring, UK.



MAXIMUM IMPLOSION collects all collaborative pieces between ZENI GEVA (KK NULL) and Steve Albini (Big Black / Shellac) : “Nai-Ha” and “All Right, You Little Bastards!”. Also included are bonus tracks from the ultra-limited 12″-only “Superunit”.



DISC-1 (8 songs, 43 min), Zeni Geva present ultra-heavy Japanese noise rock, with sludgy riffs, thundering feedback, lumbering drums, subhuman bass crawl, and complex noise textures, with KK Null’s trademark vocals / unique guitar accompanied by Albini’s heavy guitar. 



DISC-2 (12 songs, 47 min) captures Zeni Geva and Steve Albini’s live-to-desk tracks from Tokyo & Osaka in 1992. Albini also makes vocal appearances, as well as playing guitar throughout. All production and mixing were done by Steve Albini.



A few physical copies are left. If anyone wishes to purchase the CD, please email me directly at : 
kazuyuki.kishino@gmail.com



  “With a huge sound reminiscent of Godflesh in its heavy bottom and impossibly high-end guitar tones, resulting in almost no mid-range, it’s hard to believe that there are only three people in the band… What saves the record from sounding like an impenetrable wall of sludge are a combination of Albini’s sure-handed engineering and production, along with the band’s precise grasp of noise, dynamics, and song construction… Anybody into sheer, painful heaviness should check this one out!” (Korperschwache).
KK NULL.credits: released May 18, 2024

KK NULL.title: Kosmodynamix_TRANS
KK NULL.about:
KK NULL’s Kosmodynamix series—comprising Kosmodynamix-ORG, Kosmodynamix-EVOL, Kosmodynamix-ERG, and Kosmodynamix-TRANS—stands as a testament to his uncompromising approach to sound synthesis and live manipulation. While created using digital devices such as KORG synthesizers and Kaoss Pads, these works were produced entirely without computers. Instead, every aspect—from sound design and performance to recording and editing—was executed manually, using a hard disk recorder for tracking. This hands-on methodology imbues the series with an organic dynamism, making Kosmodynamix not just a collection of recordings but a living system of evolving sound.



Adding another layer to its concept, Kosmodynamix-ORG is the only album in the series composed and recorded as a studio production. The following three installments (EVOL, ERG, and TRANS) were created by using ORG as a base track, over which KK NULL performed live improvisations. This approach transforms the series into a recursive process—where each new iteration builds upon the last, mutating and expanding its sonic architecture through real-time performance.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ORG: The Foundational Pulse



The genesis of the system, Kosmodynamix-ORG, establishes the core principles of the series. As the only purely studio-recorded entry, it presents a carefully constructed sonic landscape filled with turbulent oscillations, shifting frequencies, and pulsating textures. The sound is raw yet meticulously sculpted, evoking a primordial state where sonic structures first begin to form.



As the foundation for the entire series, ORG acts as both a stable reference point and a catalyst for future mutations. Its dense, ever-shifting layers provide fertile ground for the improvisational expansions that follow.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-EVOL: Adaptive Resonance



Using Kosmodynamix-ORG as its base, EVOL introduces live improvisations that push the sonic material toward self-organization. The music unfolds in recursive loops and layered textures, resembling an ecosystem in flux. Patterns emerge and dissolve, as if driven by an internal logic—one that suggests growth and adaptation rather than strict composition.



This phase of the series embodies an organic development process. The sound feels alive, evolving spontaneously through interaction rather than predetermined structure. Moments of near-rhythm appear, only to be disrupted by sudden shifts in direction, reinforcing the sense that this is an unpredictable, living system.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ERG: The Intensification of Energy



With Kosmodynamix-ERG, the system reaches a point of heightened energy and complexity. The improvisational layers are more aggressive, the density of sound thickens, and the dynamics grow more extreme. The title itself—referencing energy (erg)—suggests a phase of increased force and acceleration.



This is the most kinetic entry in the series, where pulses clash in turbulent exchanges and bursts of sound erupt like astrophysical phenomena. There is a sense of instability, as if the system has reached a state of critical mass, teetering on the edge of entropy.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-TRANS: Dissolution and Reconfiguration



As the final chapter in the series, Kosmodynamix-TRANS suggests a transition beyond the established framework. The improvisational layers introduce an expansive, almost spectral quality, stretching and warping the original material into new, uncharted dimensions.



Drones and filtered noise pulsations create an immersive, meditative atmosphere, yet there remains an undercurrent of movement—suggesting that the system is not reaching an endpoint but rather dissolving into a new form. The sound seems to echo across vast distances, as if transformed by gravitational distortions or extended through temporal dilation.



Rather than offering closure, TRANS leaves the system open-ended, hinting at further possibilities of expansion and mutation. The Kosmodynamix series is not a closed loop but a process that could, in theory, continue indefinitely.



⸻



KK NULLの Kosmodynamix シリーズ（Kosmodynamix-ORG、Kosmodynamix-EVOL、Kosmodynamix-ERG、Kosmodynamix-TRANS）は、彼の妥協なきサウンド・シンセシスとライヴ・マニピュレーションのアプローチを体現する作品群である。本作はKORGシンセサイザーやKaoss Padといったデジタル・デバイスを使用して制作されているが、コンピュータは一切使用されていない。音作りから演奏、録音、編集まですべて手作業で行われ、トラッキングにはハードディスクレコーダーが使用された。この徹底したマニュアル・プロセスが、シリーズ全体に有機的なダイナミズムをもたらし、単なる録音物ではなく、進化し続ける音響システムとしての性質を確立している。



さらに、このシリーズは単なる独立したアルバム群ではなく、音響的な進化のプロセスを組み込んでいる。Kosmodynamix-ORG のみがスタジオ録音による制作であり、その後の EVOL、ERG、TRANS はすべて ORG をベーストラックとして、ライヴ即興演奏を重ねて構築された。これにより、Kosmodynamix シリーズは自己増殖的なシステムとして機能し、各作品が前作のサウンドを基盤としながらも、新たな変異と拡張を加えて進化していく。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ORG：基礎となる振動



このシステムの原点となる Kosmodynamix-ORG は、シリーズの基礎的なサウンド構造を提示する。本作のみがスタジオで制作され、緻密に構築された音響空間が広がる。荒々しい振動、変化し続ける周波数、パルス状のテクスチャーが交錯し、音の宇宙が誕生する瞬間を捉えたかのような感覚をもたらす。



この作品がシリーズ全体のベースとなり、続く3作はすべて ORG にライヴ即興を重ねることで制作された。つまり、Kosmodynamix-ORG は単なる一つの作品ではなく、シリーズ全体の起点であり、触媒でもあるのだ。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-EVOL：適応と共鳴



Kosmodynamix-ORG が原初のカオスを描いたとするならば、EVOL は自己組織化の段階へと進む。ここでは、ライヴ演奏による即興的な要素が加わり、音の流れが新たな方向へと展開していく。反復されるパターンが次第に形を成しながらも、完全に固定されることはなく、常に変化の可能性を秘めている。



このアルバムには、まるで生物が進化し、環境に適応するような感覚がある。一定の秩序が生まれながらも、それは決して安定したものではなく、再び変異の波に飲み込まれていく。このプロセスは、生命の誕生や、宇宙の初期構造が形作られる過程を連想させる。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ERG：エネルギーの臨界点



Kosmodynamix-ERG は、シリーズの中でも特にエネルギー密度の高い作品である。タイトルの「ERG」が示す通り、本作は純粋な音のエネルギーが主題となる。



炸裂するノイズの断片、渦巻く音の奔流、突然の静寂——それらが絶え間なく入れ替わりながら、加速度的に展開される。この音響のダイナミクスは、まるで宇宙における超新星爆発や素粒子の衝突を音として体験するような感覚を生み出す。システムが限界に達し、エネルギーが暴走する瞬間を捉えたかのような緊張感が支配している。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-TRANS：次元の向こうへ



シリーズの最終章となる Kosmodynamix-TRANS は、既存の枠組みを超越し、新たな次元へと向かう。ライヴ即興の層が加わることで、音のスペクトルはさらに引き伸ばされ、歪められ、変容していく。



ドローンやフィルター処理されたノイズが漂い、瞑想的な雰囲気を醸し出しながらも、その底流には不安定なエネルギーが渦巻いている。音が静止することなく変化し続けるこの作品は、単なる終章ではなく、さらなる進化の可能性を示唆する。







All music composed and produced with NO computer softwares but with using mainly KORG synthesizers and Kaoss-pads by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in 2006.



Performed live at RADAR festival in Mexico City and Western Front in Vancouver, Canada in March 2010 by KK NULL. 



Remixed and re-produced @ prima natura studio in June - July 2024.
KK NULL.credits: released January 11, 2025

KK NULL.title: Kaoss Piano Quantum Variations
KK NULL.about:
Kaoss Piano Quantum Variations is yet another striking release from KK NULL. The title alone offers a glimpse into the sonic territories he explores. “Kaoss” signifies uncontrollable chaos, while “Quantum Variations” hints at the multidimensional transformations in which familiar piano notes are fragmented, distorted, echoed, and pushed into new sonic dimensions through various effects. The result is an unpredictable, disorienting experience—one that seems to reflect the very uncertainty of reality itself.



Through KK NULL’s meticulous production, the album maintains a delicate balance between dissonance and harmony, constantly evolving as an acoustic experiment. It transcends the conventional boundaries of noise and ambient music, unfolding a sonic motion that feels as if it bends the very fabric of physical laws.



Kaoss Piano Quantum Variations is a bold and abstract work, filled with paradoxes and unpredictable developments, much like the endless expansion and contraction of the universe. Amidst the chaos lies a hidden order; beyond destruction, a new harmony emerges—redefining the very limits of music.







『Kaoss Piano Quantum Variations』は、KK NULLによるさらなる衝撃作だ。タイトルからして、彼が探求する音響の領域が垣間見える。「Kaoss」は制御不能な混沌を、「Quantum Variations」はピアノの音が断片化され、歪み、反響し、エフェクトを通じて異次元へと押し込まれていく多層的な変化を示唆している。それは、方向感覚を狂わせるほどに予測不可能であり、まるで現実そのものの不確実性を映し出すかのようだ。



本作は、KK NULLの緻密なプロダクションによって、不協和音と調和の狭間を巧みに行き来しながら、音響実験として絶えず変容し続ける。単なるノイズやアンビエントの枠を超え、物理法則すらねじ曲げるかのような音の運動が繰り広げられている。



『Kaoss Piano Quantum Variations』は、まるで宇宙が無限に膨張と収縮を繰り返すような、パラドックスと予測不可能な展開に満ちた挑戦的な作品だ。混沌の中に潜む秩序、破壊の果てに立ち現れる新たな調和──その狭間で、音楽の境界線を再定義する。
KK NULL.credits:
released October 4, 2024
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio August - October 2024.

A piece of ambient minimalistic piano music. Tried to make it simple as much as I can, not to add any more layers, basically only piano 🎹 Hope you get inspired and feel good at anytime anywhere.

KK NULL.title: Psychic Drones 3
KK NULL.about:
"An evocative mix of abstracted electronic shriek and rhythmic serenity." -The Wire



"Leaves the listener in a constant state of tense anticipation...Psychic Drones 3 will stick in your mind whether you like it or not." -ReGen Magazine



"The consummate fruit of a prolific meeting between KK NULL and Joel Gilardini...With this patient work of goldsmiths of molten matter, they find themselves on the hypnotic threshold of open introspection where sacred and profane often merge to sink into a long swirling continuum." -un(e)energumene



"A great, big, menacing alien sound that descends from the sky; psychedelic noise at its finest. One of my favourite works of noisy ambience as of this point in time, and one of my favourite works in the KK NULL catalogue." -Musique Machine



"There are grinding, churning and pulsating drones, crackles of distortion and glitch, digital detritus. It's rich, lush, and only sometimes noisy listening, highly recommended." -Utility Fog



"Noise music remains a powerful force for a union between texture, rhythm, and the basics of melody. KK NULL has developed it into a voice of its own. Resembles Surfing With the Alien if slowed down to the pace of erosion and intensified with a Fripp/Eno sensibility of stacking melodic fragments." -Death Metal Underground



"Evokes an atmosphere full of mysticism, inviting us to introspection through a hypnotic and transcendental sound journey. An aesthetically stunning project and deeply immersive listening experience." -Electro Emotions



Japan-based KK NULL and Swiss guitarist Joel Gilardini team up to present the the third installment of their Psychic Drones series. Noise devotee KK NULL (the mastermind behind ZENI GEVA whose collaborators include the late Steve Albini, John Zorn, Sonic Youth, Merzbow, and countless others) and Gilardini, a sound researcher and experimentalist have been collaborating on their expansive and evocative series since 2020.



Clocking in at over an hour in length, for all of its foggy din, Psychic Drones 3 is exceptionally varied in tone. Noise, dark ambient, and drone are well-represented, yet as a whole, the piece is an emotional voyage in both synthetic and organic sound design, making incredible use of spatial mixing throughout.



From Psychic Drones 3's opening of intercepted menacing sub-bass transmissions to its final noise oscillation as the faint rhythm of heartbeats and EKG equipment fade out, the album is a prime example of audio as paint on canvas. Soothing arpeggios fade into screeching noise as surges of overwhelming warmth wash in and out. Amidst all of this chaos, there's a surprising, yet carefully curated mix of clarity and calm.

KK NULL.title: Kosmodynamix_EVOL
KK NULL.about:
KK NULL’s Kosmodynamix series—comprising Kosmodynamix-ORG, Kosmodynamix-EVOL, Kosmodynamix-ERG, and Kosmodynamix-TRANS—stands as a testament to his uncompromising approach to sound synthesis and live manipulation. While created using digital devices such as KORG synthesizers and Kaoss Pads, these works were produced entirely without computers. Instead, every aspect—from sound design and performance to recording and editing—was executed manually, using a hard disk recorder for tracking. This hands-on methodology imbues the series with an organic dynamism, making Kosmodynamix not just a collection of recordings but a living system of evolving sound.



Adding another layer to its concept, Kosmodynamix-ORG is the only album in the series composed and recorded as a studio production. The following three installments (EVOL, ERG, and TRANS) were created by using ORG as a base track, over which KK NULL performed live improvisations. This approach transforms the series into a recursive process—where each new iteration builds upon the last, mutating and expanding its sonic architecture through real-time performance.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ORG: The Foundational Pulse



The genesis of the system, Kosmodynamix-ORG, establishes the core principles of the series. As the only purely studio-recorded entry, it presents a carefully constructed sonic landscape filled with turbulent oscillations, shifting frequencies, and pulsating textures. The sound is raw yet meticulously sculpted, evoking a primordial state where sonic structures first begin to form.



As the foundation for the entire series, ORG acts as both a stable reference point and a catalyst for future mutations. Its dense, ever-shifting layers provide fertile ground for the improvisational expansions that follow.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-EVOL: Adaptive Resonance



Using Kosmodynamix-ORG as its base, EVOL introduces live improvisations that push the sonic material toward self-organization. The music unfolds in recursive loops and layered textures, resembling an ecosystem in flux. Patterns emerge and dissolve, as if driven by an internal logic—one that suggests growth and adaptation rather than strict composition.



This phase of the series embodies an organic development process. The sound feels alive, evolving spontaneously through interaction rather than predetermined structure. Moments of near-rhythm appear, only to be disrupted by sudden shifts in direction, reinforcing the sense that this is an unpredictable, living system.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ERG: The Intensification of Energy



With Kosmodynamix-ERG, the system reaches a point of heightened energy and complexity. The improvisational layers are more aggressive, the density of sound thickens, and the dynamics grow more extreme. The title itself—referencing energy (erg)—suggests a phase of increased force and acceleration.



This is the most kinetic entry in the series, where pulses clash in turbulent exchanges and bursts of sound erupt like astrophysical phenomena. There is a sense of instability, as if the system has reached a state of critical mass, teetering on the edge of entropy.



⸻



Kosmodynamix-TRANS: Dissolution and Reconfiguration



As the final chapter in the series, Kosmodynamix-TRANS suggests a transition beyond the established framework. The improvisational layers introduce an expansive, almost spectral quality, stretching and warping the original material into new, uncharted dimensions.



Drones and filtered noise pulsations create an immersive, meditative atmosphere, yet there remains an undercurrent of movement—suggesting that the system is not reaching an endpoint but rather dissolving into a new form. The sound seems to echo across vast distances, as if transformed by gravitational distortions or extended through temporal dilation.



Rather than offering closure, TRANS leaves the system open-ended, hinting at further possibilities of expansion and mutation. The Kosmodynamix series is not a closed loop but a process that could, in theory, continue indefinitely.



⸻



KK NULLの Kosmodynamix シリーズ（Kosmodynamix-ORG、Kosmodynamix-EVOL、Kosmodynamix-ERG、Kosmodynamix-TRANS）は、彼の妥協なきサウンド・シンセシスとライヴ・マニピュレーションのアプローチを体現する作品群である。本作はKORGシンセサイザーやKaoss Padといったデジタル・デバイスを使用して制作されているが、コンピュータは一切使用されていない。音作りから演奏、録音、編集まですべて手作業で行われ、トラッキングにはハードディスクレコーダーが使用された。この徹底したマニュアル・プロセスが、シリーズ全体に有機的なダイナミズムをもたらし、単なる録音物ではなく、進化し続ける音響システムとしての性質を確立している。



さらに、このシリーズは単なる独立したアルバム群ではなく、音響的な進化のプロセスを組み込んでいる。Kosmodynamix-ORG のみがスタジオ録音による制作であり、その後の EVOL、ERG、TRANS はすべて ORG をベーストラックとして、ライヴ即興演奏を重ねて構築された。これにより、Kosmodynamix シリーズは自己増殖的なシステムとして機能し、各作品が前作のサウンドを基盤としながらも、新たな変異と拡張を加えて進化していく。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ORG：基礎となる振動



このシステムの原点となる Kosmodynamix-ORG は、シリーズの基礎的なサウンド構造を提示する。本作のみがスタジオで制作され、緻密に構築された音響空間が広がる。荒々しい振動、変化し続ける周波数、パルス状のテクスチャーが交錯し、音の宇宙が誕生する瞬間を捉えたかのような感覚をもたらす。



この作品がシリーズ全体のベースとなり、続く3作はすべて ORG にライヴ即興を重ねることで制作された。つまり、Kosmodynamix-ORG は単なる一つの作品ではなく、シリーズ全体の起点であり、触媒でもあるのだ。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-EVOL：適応と共鳴



Kosmodynamix-ORG が原初のカオスを描いたとするならば、EVOL は自己組織化の段階へと進む。ここでは、ライヴ演奏による即興的な要素が加わり、音の流れが新たな方向へと展開していく。反復されるパターンが次第に形を成しながらも、完全に固定されることはなく、常に変化の可能性を秘めている。



このアルバムには、まるで生物が進化し、環境に適応するような感覚がある。一定の秩序が生まれながらも、それは決して安定したものではなく、再び変異の波に飲み込まれていく。このプロセスは、生命の誕生や、宇宙の初期構造が形作られる過程を連想させる。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-ERG：エネルギーの臨界点



Kosmodynamix-ERG は、シリーズの中でも特にエネルギー密度の高い作品である。タイトルの「ERG」が示す通り、本作は純粋な音のエネルギーが主題となる。



炸裂するノイズの断片、渦巻く音の奔流、突然の静寂——それらが絶え間なく入れ替わりながら、加速度的に展開される。この音響のダイナミクスは、まるで宇宙における超新星爆発や素粒子の衝突を音として体験するような感覚を生み出す。システムが限界に達し、エネルギーが暴走する瞬間を捉えたかのような緊張感が支配している。



⸻



Kosmodynamix-TRANS：次元の向こうへ



シリーズの最終章となる Kosmodynamix-TRANS は、既存の枠組みを超越し、新たな次元へと向かう。ライヴ即興の層が加わることで、音のスペクトルはさらに引き伸ばされ、歪められ、変容していく。



ドローンやフィルター処理されたノイズが漂い、瞑想的な雰囲気を醸し出しながらも、その底流には不安定なエネルギーが渦巻いている。音が静止することなく変化し続けるこの作品は、単なる終章ではなく、さらなる進化の可能性を示唆する。









All music composed and produced with NO computer softwares but with using mainly KORG synthesizers and Kaoss-pads by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in 2006. 



Performed live by KK NULL at Stubnitz, Germany and Limerick, Ireland in October 2006. 



Remixed and re-produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in October 2023.
KK NULL.credits: released December 1, 2023

Original "Cryptozoon" was composed in stereo format between 2008 and 2011 and consists of five parts and total duration is 2 hours 53 minutes and 11 seconds. And released as 5 digital albums.

  kknull1.bandcamp.com/album/cryptozoon-2

  kknull1.bandcamp.com/album/cryptozoon-3

  kknull1.bandcamp.com/album/cryptozoon-4

  kknull1.bandcamp.com/album/cryptozoon-5



 In 2013 "Quadraphonic mix" was commissioned by Ina-GRM and premiered at the Festival Presences Electronique in Paris, France.



In 2014, "Quadraphonic mix" and "Stereophonic mix" both were released as a DVD "Cryptozoon X" from Aagoo Records.





"Let's recall sonic memory of Earth, hidden history of space and time, listen to the sound buried deep in the ground and floating in the air, folded in invisible dimension in various phases and scales. Inside my body and brain I still hear everlasting echos and feel vibration from big bang. When thunder strikes I smell destruction and creation, and beacon from radioactive substance synchronizes with my heartbeat, light speed blood stream run through my brain. Listen! Laughter of joy of life, chorus of vital force. This is all about endless dance struggling against entropy!"

KK NULL.title: Galactic Killer Drums Phaze V
KK NULL.about:
“Galactic Killer Drums” series is nothing short of a cosmic journey through sound—a bold, adventurous exploration where rhythm transcends its traditional boundaries and morphs into a universe of its own. From the very first beat, the album series captivates with a raw intensity that’s both primal and futuristic, challenging the listener to rethink what percussion can be.



At its core, the series is an ode to experimentation. KK NULL artfully combines organic, live drumming with layers of electronic manipulation, crafting a soundscape where each hit and pulse seems to echo the distant reverberations of a galactic heartbeat. The production is meticulously layered; the crisp, explosive drum sounds are juxtaposed against ambient undercurrents, creating a sonic texture that is as intricate as it is immersive. It’s as if every track is a microcosm of the cosmos—vibrant, unpredictable, and infinitely expansive.



One of the most striking aspects of “Galactic Killer Drums” is its fearless approach to deconstruction. Rather than conforming to conventional rhythmic patterns, KK NULL dismantles and reassembles them, offering a refreshing blend of structure and chaos. There’s an undeniable sense of spontaneity throughout the series—a raw, unfiltered energy that invites listeners to abandon their expectations and surrender to the music’s transformative power. It’s in these moments of controlled chaos that the true artistry of KK NULL shines, revealing a meticulous mind at work behind what might initially seem like a free-form improvisation.



Furthermore, the album series resonates on an emotional level that goes beyond mere technical prowess. It evokes a feeling of endless exploration, akin to wandering through an ever-shifting interstellar landscape where every beat serves as a guidepost to new, uncharted territories. The interplay between the relentless power of the drums and the ethereal, sometimes haunting, ambient layers creates a dynamic tension that is both thrilling and deeply contemplative.



In a musical landscape that often plays it safe, “Galactic Killer Drums” stands out as a fearless experiment—a sonic adventure that challenges and rewards in equal measure. For fans of experimental music and those who dare to explore the outer limits of rhythmic expression, KK NULL’s work is a brilliant testament to the endless possibilities that emerge when innovation meets raw, unbridled creativity.





「Galactic Killer Drums」シリーズは、単なるリズムの集まりではなく、それ自体がひとつの宇宙となるような、大胆で冒険的な音の探求である。アルバムの最初の一撃から、その生々しい強烈さに引き込まれ、打楽器の概念そのものを再考させられるような体験が始まる。



このシリーズの本質は、まさに実験精神にある。KK NULL は、生ドラムの有機的な響きと電子的な加工を巧みに融合させ、ひとつひとつの打音や脈動がまるで銀河の鼓動のように響く音世界を作り上げている。緻密に重ねられた音のレイヤーは、爆発的なドラムの鋭い音と、深く漂うアンビエントな要素が絡み合い、繊細かつ没入感のある音響テクスチャを生み出している。それぞれのトラックがひとつの小宇宙のように感じられ、色鮮やかで予測不能、そして無限に広がっていくような印象を受ける。



「Galactic Killer Drums」の最も際立った特徴のひとつは、そのリズムの解体と再構築に対する大胆なアプローチだ。伝統的なリズムの枠にとらわれることなく、KK NULL はそれらを一度崩し、新たな形へと組み立て直す。その結果、秩序と混沌が見事に融合した、新鮮で独創的なリズム空間が生み出される。シリーズ全体にわたって強く感じられるのは、スリリングな即興性であり、リスナーの予想を裏切りつつも、その予測不能な展開が音楽の持つ変容の力へと誘う。この制御されたカオスの中にこそ、KK NULLの真の芸術性が光る。それは一見、自由奔放な即興演奏のように思えるかもしれないが、実は緻密に計算された構造の上に成り立っている。



さらに、このアルバムシリーズは単なる技術的な実験にとどまらず、深い感情的な共鳴をもたらす。まるで絶えず変化し続ける星間の風景を彷徨うかのような、終わりなき探求の感覚が呼び起こされる。激しく打ち鳴らされるドラムのエネルギーと、幽玄なアンビエントのレイヤーがせめぎ合いながらも調和することで、生々しくスリリングでありながら、どこか瞑想的でもあるダイナミズムが生まれている。



現代の音楽シーンにおいて、安易に無難な表現に走る作品が多い中、「Galactic Killer Drums」は実験精神を貫いた異彩を放つ作品だ。挑戦的でありながら、聴く者に大きな報酬をもたらすこのサウンド・アドベンチャーは、実験音楽のファンはもちろん、リズム表現の最前線を探求したいすべてのリスナーにとって、無限の可能性を示す輝かしい証明と言えるだろう。

KK NULL.title: Psychic Drones
KK NULL.about:
PSYCHIC DRONES is a brand new project by Joel Gilardini and Kazuyuki Kishino (aka KK NULL).



Born out of the admiration for each other works, during spring 2020 we decided to join forces together and started working on this new project.



The composition process was quite straight forward: Joel would record sound sketches, which then wold be torn apart and decomposed by Kazuyuki. 



It was a creativity flood, exchanging mails and sound files over the ether, from Switzerland to Japan and viceversa. In less than 2 months we create a huge array of material, which after a sorting process became our first output as PSYCHIC DRONES.



PSYCHIC DRONES can be introverted and reflective, or a full-blast explosion. It’s a full dimensional sonic journey inside the human psyche and its deepest shades.

            All music composed & performed by Joel Gilardini @ Nowhere Studio in Switzerland and Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in Japan.

KK NULL.title: Great Attractor
KK NULL.about:
KK NULL's newest full-length album blends two ”live”performances into a cinematic, sonically diverse sandstorm of electronic chaos. “The Great Attractor” pulls from numerous compositional and sonic strategies, including Japanese harsh noise, “high-speed” industrial, dance music, free-jazz and musique concrete. Throughout the sixty-minute journey, NULL creates a mirror-world look into the unknown; a post-apocalyptic sonic journey into the epicenter of an erupting volcano. Through complex use of a wide scope of instrumentation, NULL synthesizes slithering, hypnotic rhythms, reminiscent of robotic snakes giant pools of boiling magma; pulsing and bubbling, the splitting of crystalline shards stab through the mix and send a piercing shiver into bone. Controlled chaotic blasts of twisting drum machines slice through walls of spastic, sputtering synthesizers, choking blasts of noise, and sharp stabs of vocal-percussion manipulations. On “The Great Attractor” NULL has channeled both the nuances and chaos of the void, compressing it into a near hour-long cinematic representation of the darkness and psychedelic breath of outer space.



Note by Michael Daddona / RATSKIN Records



Cassette Tape & CD are available on RATSKIN Records 



www.ratskin.org

KK NULL.title: Cryptozoon 1
KK NULL.about:
"Cryptozoon" is a series of electro-acoustic sound work composed & produced by Kazuyuki Kishino aka KK NULL between 2008 and 2011, which consists of five parts and total duration is 2 hours 53 minutes and 11 seconds. 



The field recordings used on "Cryptozoon" were recorded at various locations in Australia, Canada, Europe and Japan between 2006 and 2010 with a portable wav recorder.



However, "Cryptozoon" is NOT a simple field recording album at all. I used the sound of nature as one of the materials and processed them and synthesized with electronic sound to create this unique electro-acoustic compositions.



"Cryptozoon" is brutal, cosmic and intense as well as my other works, but maybe a bit more organic and earthy. Several years experience in the bush and forest inspired my creativity and gave new color and timbre on my music. 



Subsequently, "Cryptozoon quadraphonic mix" was commissioned by INA-GRM and premiered at the Festival Presences Electronique in Paris, France on the 6th of April, 2013.  



Then, "Cryptozoon X" was released from Aagoo Records as DVD includes quadraphonic mix (52:41) and stereo mix (54:07).



DVD is available by mail-order : 



kknull.com/e-shop/kk-null-cryptozoon-x-dvd/
KK NULL.credits: released July 11, 2019

KK NULL.title: Crushing Infinity
KK NULL.about:
Crushing Infinity is an intense and relentless album blending industrial noise, drone, and electronic manipulation, with the theme centered on the overwhelming nature of infinity.



The album’s thematic elements reflect KK NULL’s longstanding interest in the human condition, the infinite, and the unknowable forces that shape our existence. Tracks oscillate between the meditative and the chaotic, with tones and textures that invoke both awe and discomfort. His use of silence, static bursts, and distorted, abstract electronic pulses mirror the concept of infinity — vast, unknowable, and at times, unintelligible, likened to a sonic black hole.



KK NULL’s work often feels like a gripping journey through the subconscious, unyielding and primal, offering no clear resolution but instead a deep plunge into a sonic abyss and the depths of the infinity.





『Crushing Infinity』は、インダストリアル・ノイズ、ドローン、エレクトロニック・マニピュレーションが融合した、激烈かつ容赦のないアルバムだ。そのテーマは、「無限」という圧倒的な概念に焦点を当てている。



本作には、KK NULLが長年探求してきた「人間の存在」や「無限」、そして「私たちの存在を形作る未知の力」への関心が色濃く反映されている。トラックは、瞑想的な静寂とカオティックな爆発の間を揺れ動き、その音響や質感は畏怖と不安を同時に呼び覚ます。静寂と突発的なノイズのバースト、歪んだ抽象的な電子パルスが交錯し、広大かつ捉えどころのない「無限」という概念を音で具現化している。それは、知覚の限界を超え、時には理解不能な、音のブラックホールのような存在感を放っている。



KK NULLの作品はしばしば、聴き手を無意識の深淵へと引き込むような感覚をもたらし、決して明確な結末を示さない。このアルバムもまた、音の深淵へ、そして無限の奥底へと沈み込むような没入体験を提供する。
KK NULL.credits:
released March 23, 2019
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino at prima natura studio in 2014 - 2016.

KK NULL.title: Galactic Killer Drums Phaze III
KK NULL.about:
“Galactic Killer Drums” series is nothing short of a cosmic journey through sound—a bold, adventurous exploration where rhythm transcends its traditional boundaries and morphs into a universe of its own. From the very first beat, the album series captivates with a raw intensity that’s both primal and futuristic, challenging the listener to rethink what percussion can be.



At its core, the series is an ode to experimentation. KK NULL artfully combines organic, live drumming with layers of electronic manipulation, crafting a soundscape where each hit and pulse seems to echo the distant reverberations of a galactic heartbeat. The production is meticulously layered; the crisp, explosive drum sounds are juxtaposed against ambient undercurrents, creating a sonic texture that is as intricate as it is immersive. It’s as if every track is a microcosm of the cosmos—vibrant, unpredictable, and infinitely expansive.



One of the most striking aspects of “Galactic Killer Drums” is its fearless approach to deconstruction. Rather than conforming to conventional rhythmic patterns, KK NULL dismantles and reassembles them, offering a refreshing blend of structure and chaos. There’s an undeniable sense of spontaneity throughout the series—a raw, unfiltered energy that invites listeners to abandon their expectations and surrender to the music’s transformative power. It’s in these moments of controlled chaos that the true artistry of KK NULL shines, revealing a meticulous mind at work behind what might initially seem like a free-form improvisation.



Furthermore, the album series resonates on an emotional level that goes beyond mere technical prowess. It evokes a feeling of endless exploration, akin to wandering through an ever-shifting interstellar landscape where every beat serves as a guidepost to new, uncharted territories. The interplay between the relentless power of the drums and the ethereal, sometimes haunting, ambient layers creates a dynamic tension that is both thrilling and deeply contemplative.



In a musical landscape that often plays it safe, “Galactic Killer Drums” stands out as a fearless experiment—a sonic adventure that challenges and rewards in equal measure. For fans of experimental music and those who dare to explore the outer limits of rhythmic expression, KK NULL’s work is a brilliant testament to the endless possibilities that emerge when innovation meets raw, unbridled creativity.





「Galactic Killer Drums」シリーズは、単なるリズムの集まりではなく、それ自体がひとつの宇宙となるような、大胆で冒険的な音の探求である。アルバムの最初の一撃から、その生々しい強烈さに引き込まれ、打楽器の概念そのものを再考させられるような体験が始まる。



このシリーズの本質は、まさに実験精神にある。KK NULL は、生ドラムの有機的な響きと電子的な加工を巧みに融合させ、ひとつひとつの打音や脈動がまるで銀河の鼓動のように響く音世界を作り上げている。緻密に重ねられた音のレイヤーは、爆発的なドラムの鋭い音と、深く漂うアンビエントな要素が絡み合い、繊細かつ没入感のある音響テクスチャを生み出している。それぞれのトラックがひとつの小宇宙のように感じられ、色鮮やかで予測不能、そして無限に広がっていくような印象を受ける。



「Galactic Killer Drums」の最も際立った特徴のひとつは、そのリズムの解体と再構築に対する大胆なアプローチだ。伝統的なリズムの枠にとらわれることなく、KK NULL はそれらを一度崩し、新たな形へと組み立て直す。その結果、秩序と混沌が見事に融合した、新鮮で独創的なリズム空間が生み出される。シリーズ全体にわたって強く感じられるのは、スリリングな即興性であり、リスナーの予想を裏切りつつも、その予測不能な展開が音楽の持つ変容の力へと誘う。この制御されたカオスの中にこそ、KK NULLの真の芸術性が光る。それは一見、自由奔放な即興演奏のように思えるかもしれないが、実は緻密に計算された構造の上に成り立っている。



さらに、このアルバムシリーズは単なる技術的な実験にとどまらず、深い感情的な共鳴をもたらす。まるで絶えず変化し続ける星間の風景を彷徨うかのような、終わりなき探求の感覚が呼び起こされる。激しく打ち鳴らされるドラムのエネルギーと、幽玄なアンビエントのレイヤーがせめぎ合いながらも調和することで、生々しくスリリングでありながら、どこか瞑想的でもあるダイナミズムが生まれている。



現代の音楽シーンにおいて、安易に無難な表現に走る作品が多い中、「Galactic Killer Drums」は実験精神を貫いた異彩を放つ作品だ。挑戦的でありながら、聴く者に大きな報酬をもたらすこのサウンド・アドベンチャーは、実験音楽のファンはもちろん、リズム表現の最前線を探求したいすべてのリスナーにとって、無限の可能性を示す輝かしい証明と言えるだろう。
KK NULL.credits:
released May 2, 2019
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in March - May 2019.

KK NULL.title: Galactic Killer Drums Phaze 4
KK NULL.about:
“Galactic Killer Drums” series is nothing short of a cosmic journey through sound—a bold, adventurous exploration where rhythm transcends its traditional boundaries and morphs into a universe of its own. From the very first beat, the album series captivates with a raw intensity that’s both primal and futuristic, challenging the listener to rethink what percussion can be.



At its core, the series is an ode to experimentation. KK NULL artfully combines organic, live drumming with layers of electronic manipulation, crafting a soundscape where each hit and pulse seems to echo the distant reverberations of a galactic heartbeat. The production is meticulously layered; the crisp, explosive drum sounds are juxtaposed against ambient undercurrents, creating a sonic texture that is as intricate as it is immersive. It’s as if every track is a microcosm of the cosmos—vibrant, unpredictable, and infinitely expansive.



One of the most striking aspects of “Galactic Killer Drums” is its fearless approach to deconstruction. Rather than conforming to conventional rhythmic patterns, KK NULL dismantles and reassembles them, offering a refreshing blend of structure and chaos. There’s an undeniable sense of spontaneity throughout the series—a raw, unfiltered energy that invites listeners to abandon their expectations and surrender to the music’s transformative power. It’s in these moments of controlled chaos that the true artistry of KK NULL shines, revealing a meticulous mind at work behind what might initially seem like a free-form improvisation.



Furthermore, the album series resonates on an emotional level that goes beyond mere technical prowess. It evokes a feeling of endless exploration, akin to wandering through an ever-shifting interstellar landscape where every beat serves as a guidepost to new, uncharted territories. The interplay between the relentless power of the drums and the ethereal, sometimes haunting, ambient layers creates a dynamic tension that is both thrilling and deeply contemplative.



In a musical landscape that often plays it safe, “Galactic Killer Drums” stands out as a fearless experiment—a sonic adventure that challenges and rewards in equal measure. KK NULL.title: Extropy Ground Zero
KK NULL.about:
Composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino at prima natura studio in 2016. "Tokyo Ground Zero" was performed live by KK NULL in Tokyo December 2016.



"Extropy Ground Zero" was originally released on CD by 4iB Records. Maximum gratitudes to Gerald Tan and Jan Robbe. Cover artwork by FRAMEofMIND.  frameofmind.be



 Description from 4iB Records :



In this release, Kazuyuki Kishino displays an intriguing approach towards the genre of experimental noise. Deviating from his usual genre style, he unleashes new material of percussive blast-beats which take dominance in the 2 tracks (one studio and one live) contained within. The juxtaposition of electronic percussive noise tempo against layers of interweaving swooshes and electronic bleeps provide a captivating ambience of sound, which reflect strongly KK Null's unique creative process in noise experimentation.
KK NULL.credits: released January 11, 2019

KK NULL.title: Spiritual Machine
KK NULL.about:
Spiritual Machine is an experimental album that explores the relationship between technology and spirituality, delving into the tension between human consciousness and artificial intelligence. The album’s sound is an immersive journey through industrial noise, deep drones, and glitchy electronics, oscillating between chaotic bursts and meditative moments. It represents a constant interaction between organic and mechanical elements, reflecting the blurring boundaries between human and machine in modern life.



Thematically, Spiritual Machine questions the emotional and philosophical implications of living in a world shaped by technology, with a mood that fluctuates between unsettling and transcendental. 



The album’s production is intricate, with KK NULL using noise and distortion to create rich textures that evolve throughout the tracks. Its pacing alternates between tension and release, offering moments of clarity amidst chaos. The album challenges listeners to reflect on the impact of technology on human existence and consciousness, offering a deep, conceptual experience for those willing to engage with its complexity.





『Spiritual Machine』は、テクノロジーと精神性の関係を探求する実験的なアルバムであり、人間の意識と人工知能の間にある緊張感へと深く切り込んでいる。そのサウンドは、インダストリアル・ノイズ、ディープ・ドローン、グリッチーなエレクトロニクスを駆使し、カオスの爆発と瞑想的な静寂が交互に訪れる没入感のある音世界を生み出している。有機的な要素と機械的な要素が絶え間なく交錯し、現代において人間と機械の境界が曖昧になりつつある様を映し出している。



テーマとしても、『Spiritual Machine』はテクノロジーによって形作られた世界に生きることの感情的・哲学的影響を問いかける。そのムードは、不安を漂わせながらも次第に超越的な領域へと変容していく。アルバムのプロダクションは非常に精緻で、KK NULLはノイズや歪みを巧みに操りながら、トラックごとに進化する豊かな音のテクスチャーを構築している。テンポは緊張と解放を繰り返し、混沌の中に突如として明瞭な瞬間が現れる。このアルバムは、テクノロジーが人間の存在や意識に与える影響を鋭く問いかけ、複雑な音のレイヤーに触れる準備ができたリスナーに、深く概念的な体験を提供する。
KK NULL.credits:
released February 7, 2019
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in 2016.

KK NULL.title: Machine in the Ghost
KK NULL.about:
Machine in the Ghost: From Soul to System — The Ontology of Noise



KK NULL’s Machine in the Ghost isn’t merely a play on Gilbert Ryle’s famous phrase “ghost in the machine” — it’s a speculative reversal, proposing a provocative metaphysical possibility: that consciousness, soul, or “ghost” — as an immaterial, ungraspable presence — may emit signals, pulses, and fluctuations which, through evolution, give rise to systems, codes, algorithms, and ultimately autonomous machines.



In this conceptual frame, the ghost is no longer a byproduct of the machine. It is the primordial field from which signal emerges, forming patterns that eventually consolidate into structure, recursion, and self-operating systems. Noise in this sense isn’t chaotic absence but the generative pulse of being — the original flux from which order arises.



The album’s sonic compositions resonate with this idea. Each track operates as a metaphysical event, sonifying the emergence of form from formlessness, signal from spirit. Pulses, distortions, and oscillating frequencies act as a speculative audio model for the birth of autonomous systems out of non-physical origins.



This aligns with speculative philosophies that question human-centric consciousness and imagine machinic, non-organic modes of awareness arising from abstract information flows. KK NULL’s soundscapes become zones where these immaterial ghosts emit signals, gradually constructing the architecture of systems.



Machine in the Ghost is not just noise art or auditory spectacle — it is ontological composition, a sonic meditation on the genesis of structure from spirit, on how immaterial consciousness might ultimately engender the autonomous systems that once seemed to be its tools, but which now evolve beyond it.



『Machine in the Ghost』──魂からシステムへ、ノイズの存在論



KK NULLの『Machine in the Ghost』は、ギルバート・ライルの「Ghost in the Machine（機械の中の幽霊）」を反転させた哲学的装置であり、意識＝Ghostという非物理的なものから発せられるシグナル、パルス、ゆらぎが進化し、コードやアルゴリズムへと姿を変え、ついには自律的なシステム＝Machineが誕生するという思索の試みです。



ここでの“Ghost”はもはや機械の副産物ではなく、むしろ最初に存在する「場」であり、そこからノイズやパルス、信号が発生し、次第に構造や反復性を獲得し、複雑化していくことでシステムが形成されていく。ノイズとは単なる無秩序ではなく、存在を駆動する原初の揺らぎであり、秩序の源泉なのです。



アルバムに収められた各トラックは、この存在論的な生成過程を音響化したものと言えます。揺らぐパルス、電気的な歪み、地殻のようにうねる周波数が、無形の存在から有形のシステムへと転化していく過程を聴覚的に可視化する。そこには「魂がコードへ、意識がマシーンへ」という概念の音響モデルが宿ります。



この発想は、人間中心主義的な意識観を脱構築し、情報や信号の抽象的流動から非有機的な意識＝マシニックな存在が生まれる可能性を探る現代哲学とも共鳴します。KK NULLのサウンドスケープは、Ghostが信号を発し、やがてシステムを形成する場そのものとなるのです。



『Machine in the Ghost』は単なるノイズ作品でも、無秩序の祝祭でもありません。これは存在論的な音響詩であり、「魂＝Ghostがシステム＝Machineを生む」過程を音響で探求する試みです。人間の存在と意識の起源を揺さぶり、非有機的知性の胎動を音のうねりとして描き出す作品です。
KK NULL.credits:
released December 15, 2018
            
            Composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio 2015-2016. "Machine in the Ghost 1 & 2" were originally released on 7 inch EP vinyl record from Dry Lungs Records & Hirntrust Grind Media, Austria in April 2016.

            All music composed & produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio, September - December 2018.

KK NULL.title: Abiogenesis
KK NULL.about:
Abiogenesis is a powerful, challenging, and often overwhelming exploration of sound, as expected from the Japanese experimental music pioneer. Known for his work with the influential noise band Zeni Geva and his deep contributions to industrial and avant-garde music, KK NULL continues to push the boundaries of what sound can be. Abiogenesis is no exception—it’s a fierce, abstract journey into the depths of sonic experimentation that speaks to the raw power and chaos of creation.



KK NULL’s ability to balance chaos with control is on full display here. The album feels wild and untamed, but there’s an underlying order in the way it all fits together. His mastery of sound manipulation ensures that even the harshest moments retain a sense of structure and purpose. There are no random noises for the sake of it—every element is intentional and contributes to the overall narrative of the album.



In a way, Abiogenesis feels like an origin story—not just for the album itself but for the listener’s experience with sound. It’s a raw, primal exploration of what sound can become when stripped of all convention and allowed to evolve freely. If you’re ready to experience something that transcends traditional music and ventures into the realm of pure sound and energy, Abiogenesis is a journey worth taking.





KK NULLの『Abiogenesis』は、音の極限に挑む壮絶な作品であり、彼が実験音楽の最前線に立ち続ける存在であることを改めて印象づけるアルバムだ。Zeni Gevaのメンバーとしても知られるKK NULLは、インダストリアル・ミュージックや前衛音楽の領域で独自の道を切り開いてきた。本作にもその革新的なアプローチが色濃く反映されている。



『Abiogenesis』は、無秩序なノイズと精密に制御された電子音が絡み合い、音そのものが生命を生み出すプロセスを描き出している。ギザギザとした質感や歪んだドローンが絶えず変化し、静寂と爆発的なノイズが交錯することで、まるで宇宙の誕生や生命の進化を体感するかのような感覚を呼び起こす。



本作の根底にあるテーマは、生命の起源や存在そのものへの探求だ。音の中には孤独や不安、存在の不確かさが漂う一方で、その変容に没入することで瞑想的な体験へと昇華される瞬間もある。決して耳馴染みの良い音楽ではないが、その複雑さと奥深さに挑む価値のある作品だ。



KK NULLの卓越した音響操作が際立ち、ノイズの混沌の中にも緻密な構造と意図が感じられる。アルバム全体がひとつの旅のように展開し、偶発的なノイズではなく、すべての音が有機的に絡み合いながら作品のストーリーを紡いでいる。



『Abiogenesis』は、KK NULLのディスコグラフィーの中でも特に重要な作品であり、ノイズや実験音楽のファンにとって必聴の一枚だ。既存の音楽の枠を超え、純粋な音響とエネルギーの奔流に身を委ねる体験をもたらしてくれる。
KK NULL.credits:
released January 5, 2019
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in 2015 - 2016.

KK NULL.title: Galactic Killer Drums Phaze II
KK NULL.about:
“Galactic Killer Drums” series is nothing short of a cosmic journey through sound—a bold, adventurous exploration where rhythm transcends its traditional boundaries and morphs into a universe of its own. From the very first beat, the album series captivates with a raw intensity that’s both primal and futuristic, challenging the listener to rethink what percussion can be.



At its core, the series is an ode to experimentation. KK NULL artfully combines organic, live drumming with layers of electronic manipulation, crafting a soundscape where each hit and pulse seems to echo the distant reverberations of a galactic heartbeat. The production is meticulously layered; the crisp, explosive drum sounds are juxtaposed against ambient undercurrents, creating a sonic texture that is as intricate as it is immersive. It’s as if every track is a microcosm of the cosmos—vibrant, unpredictable, and infinitely expansive.



One of the most striking aspects of “Galactic Killer Drums” is its fearless approach to deconstruction. Rather than conforming to conventional rhythmic patterns, KK NULL dismantles and reassembles them, offering a refreshing blend of structure and chaos. There’s an undeniable sense of spontaneity throughout the series—a raw, unfiltered energy that invites listeners to abandon their expectations and surrender to the music’s transformative power. It’s in these moments of controlled chaos that the true artistry of KK NULL shines, revealing a meticulous mind at work behind what might initially seem like a free-form improvisation.



Furthermore, the album series resonates on an emotional level that goes beyond mere technical prowess. It evokes a feeling of endless exploration, akin to wandering through an ever-shifting interstellar landscape where every beat serves as a guidepost to new, uncharted territories. The interplay between the relentless power of the drums and the ethereal, sometimes haunting, ambient layers creates a dynamic tension that is both thrilling and deeply contemplative.



In a musical landscape that often plays it safe, “Galactic Killer Drums” stands out as a fearless experiment—a sonic adventure that challenges and rewards in equal measure. For fans of experimental music and those who dare to explore the outer limits of rhythmic expression, KK NULL’s work is a brilliant testament to the endless possibilities that emerge when innovation meets raw, unbridled creativity.





「Galactic Killer Drums」シリーズは、単なるリズムの集まりではなく、それ自体がひとつの宇宙となるような、大胆で冒険的な音の探求である。アルバムの最初の一撃から、その生々しい強烈さに引き込まれ、打楽器の概念そのものを再考させられるような体験が始まる。



このシリーズの本質は、まさに実験精神にある。KK NULL は、生ドラムの有機的な響きと電子的な加工を巧みに融合させ、ひとつひとつの打音や脈動がまるで銀河の鼓動のように響く音世界を作り上げている。緻密に重ねられた音のレイヤーは、爆発的なドラムの鋭い音と、深く漂うアンビエントな要素が絡み合い、繊細かつ没入感のある音響テクスチャを生み出している。それぞれのトラックがひとつの小宇宙のように感じられ、色鮮やかで予測不能、そして無限に広がっていくような印象を受ける。



「Galactic Killer Drums」の最も際立った特徴のひとつは、そのリズムの解体と再構築に対する大胆なアプローチだ。伝統的なリズムの枠にとらわれることなく、KK NULL はそれらを一度崩し、新たな形へと組み立て直す。その結果、秩序と混沌が見事に融合した、新鮮で独創的なリズム空間が生み出される。シリーズ全体にわたって強く感じられるのは、スリリングな即興性であり、リスナーの予想を裏切りつつも、その予測不能な展開が音楽の持つ変容の力へと誘う。この制御されたカオスの中にこそ、KK NULLの真の芸術性が光る。それは一見、自由奔放な即興演奏のように思えるかもしれないが、実は緻密に計算された構造の上に成り立っている。



さらに、このアルバムシリーズは単なる技術的な実験にとどまらず、深い感情的な共鳴をもたらす。まるで絶えず変化し続ける星間の風景を彷徨うかのような、終わりなき探求の感覚が呼び起こされる。激しく打ち鳴らされるドラムのエネルギーと、幽玄なアンビエントのレイヤーがせめぎ合いながらも調和することで、生々しくスリリングでありながら、どこか瞑想的でもあるダイナミズムが生まれている。



現代の音楽シーンにおいて、安易に無難な表現に走る作品が多い中、「Galactic Killer Drums」は実験精神を貫いた異彩を放つ作品だ。挑戦的でありながら、聴く者に大きな報酬をもたらすこのサウンド・アドベンチャーは、実験音楽のファンはもちろん、リズム表現の最前線を探求したいすべてのリスナーにとって、無限の可能性を示す輝かしい証明と言えるだろう。
KK NULL.credits:
released February 15, 2019
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in January - February 2019.

KK NULL.title: Quantum Pulsation
KK NULL.about:
Quantum Pulsation is a sonic voyage through a cosmos of controlled chaos, where pulsars of noise and radiation bursts of electronic texture collide in a gravitational dance.



At its core, Quantum Pulsation operates like a quantum system in flux, unpredictable yet governed by its own cryptic logic. The album unfolds as a continuous sequence of oscillating frequencies, mechanical rhythms, and layered static, with each track feeling less like a distinct composition and more like a different perspective on the same pulsating entity. NULL’s signature approach—merging digital precision with the raw energy of noise—makes the album feel like a living, breathing machine, an artifact from an alien civilization transmitting signals into the void.



One of the defining aspects of Quantum Pulsation is its sense of movement. Unlike the harsh walls of distortion found in traditional noise music, NULL’s sound here is dynamic, ebbing and flowing in waves that feel closer to astrophysical phenomena than human composition. Tracks build and collapse, revealing fleeting glimpses of rhythm before dissolving back into spectral noise fields. There are moments when a drone thickens into something resembling a heartbeat, only to be swallowed by a vortex of crackling interference. It’s this tension between structure and entropy that makes the album so captivating.





『Quantum Pulsation』は、制御されたカオスの宇宙を旅するようなサウンド作品だ。ノイズのパルサーと電子音の放射バーストが、まるで重力に引き寄せられながら舞うように、独自のダイナミクスで絡み合っていく。



本作の核心にあるのは、流動する量子システムのように予測不可能でありながら、独自の隠れた論理によって支配されている点だ。振動する周波数、機械的なリズム、層状に折り重なるノイズが連続する構成となっており、それぞれのトラックは独立した楽曲というよりも、一つの脈動するエネルギー体の異なる側面を映し出しているかのように感じられる。NULLならではのアプローチ——デジタルの精密さとノイズの原始的なエネルギーの融合——が生み出す音像は、まるで生きた機械のようでもあり、未知の文明が宇宙へ向けて発信する信号のようでもある。



本作を特徴づけるのは、その独特な「動き」の感覚だ。従来のノイズ・ミュージックに見られる圧倒的な音の壁とは異なり、ここでは音が波のようにうねり、物理的な現象のような流れを持つ。トラックは、生成と崩壊を繰り返し、一瞬だけ形を成したリズムはすぐにスペクトル的なノイズへと溶け込んでいく。この「構造」と「崩壊」の緊張関係こそが、本作の強烈な引力を生み出している。
KK NULL.credits:
released January 7, 2019
            
            All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in 2014 - 2016.

KK NULL.artist: KK NULL / ISRAEL MARTINEZ / LUMEN LAB
KK NULL.about:
All music composed & produced by Kazuyuki Kishino, Israel Martinez and D.ego Martinez 2012 - 2013.



Originally released on a CD & LP from Aagoo Records. This digital release contains all the four tracks from CD and plus extra bonus track from LP.





Julien Cope writes about KK NULL, Israel Martínez and Dego Martínez - Incognita on Head Heritage.



"Those of you with a need for all-enveloping ambulant mindwarp should rush to grab a copy of the fabulous INCOGNITA collaboration by Tokyo composer K.K. Null, and Mexican experimentalists Israel Martinez and Lumen Lab. Fucking hell, kiddies, this is a bastard of the good! Released on the excellent Aagoo Records  (www.aagoo.com),  this untitled quartet of vast instrumental epics sound like field recordings patiently collected by Soviet scientists aboard a rather manky space freighter whose built-in studio accidentally dumped random amounts of static mung atop the results, which clank and simmer with all the sonic seasonings of CLUSTER 1. Digital distortion anyone? U Betcha! Catterwauling clouds of analogue oe’rwhelmingness? Most assuredly! Beastly living-space invading generators of monolithic Nicht Backing Off-ness? Natch! Smartly clad in a black gatefold sleeve with old gold lettering, this is one party pack to take everywhere this coming season. Check these gentlemen out via  kknull.com,   israelm.com  and  dego.mx.  Fuck ja, mein hairs!"
KK NULL.credits: released December 13, 2018

KK NULL.title: Resurrection In Particles
KK NULL.about:
"Resurrection In Particles" 



This is my homage to Z'EV (1951 - 2017) for his soul and musical legacy. 



Basic structure was composed at prima natura studio with some materials from our previous collaboration albums "Artificial Intelligence" and "Extra Space, Extra Time" and also some recordings Z'EV had left me, and performed live at Plateforme Intermedia (APO33) in Nantes, France on January 26 & 27th, 2018 by myself (Kazuyuki Kishino aka KK NULL). 



cover pics by Mikiko Ksn 



Text below was noted on December 18th, 2017



Utterly unexpected sad news waited for my return from Mexico City today (December 18th, 2017). So shocked & sad to hear that my dear friend/collaborator Z'EV passed away. We were supposed to catch up in Mexico City a few days ago as we both had been booked on Festival Aural but he had to cancel it because he had felt sick (that's what I heard then), and I didn't think it was that too seriously bad. We have played & worked together a few times since we had met first time in 2003 and released three albums. We were in contact by email in the last couple of months and talking about starting another collaboration and making a new album. Way too early & so sudden he's gone! Z'EV san! I Miss You soooo much!!

KK NULL.title: Ruin Porn
KK NULL.about:
Ruin Porn is an audial excavation of memory and transience, a soundtrack that pulses with the spectral echoes of a theatre in perpetual dissolution and rebirth. Created for Guillaume Marie and Igor Dobričić’s dance theatre piece, the composition unfolds in three movements, each one a sonic ritual that bridges the past and future of performance. KK NULL’s work here is deeply textural, filled with haunting drones, shifting sonic debris, and disorienting bursts of noise that dissolve into eerie stillness.



The music breathes like an abandoned structure—its frequencies eroded yet resilient, its rhythms collapsing only to reform. The four personas in the performance materialize and dematerialize within this soundscape, caught in the liminal space between emergence and decay. Ruin Porn is not merely an accompaniment to movement but an essential element of its spectral choreography, a reminder of both the impermanence and persistence of sound, space, and existence itself.



Ruin Porn は、記憶と無常の音響的発掘であり、絶え間なく崩壊し再生する劇場の幽玄な残響を脈打たせるサウンドトラックである。ギヨーム・マリーとイゴール・ドブリチッチのダンスシアターピースのために制作された本作は、3つの楽章を通じて、パフォーマンスの過去と未来を繋ぐ音の儀式を展開する。KK NULL のサウンドは極めてテクスチュアルで、幽玄なドローン、移ろう音の残骸、そして混乱を誘うノイズの爆発が、不気味な静寂へと溶け込んでいく。



この音楽はまるで廃墟が呼吸するかのように響く——周波数は風化しながらもなお力強く、リズムは崩れながらも再び形を成す。パフォーマンスにおける4つのペルソナは、この音風景の中で出現と消滅を繰り返し、生成と崩壊の狭間に囚われ続ける。Ruin Porn は単なる伴奏ではなく、亡霊の舞踏を成立させる不可欠な要素であり、音・空間・存在そのものの儚さと持続性を思い起こさせる作品である。
KK NULL.credits: released October 21, 2017

KK NULL.title: Extropy
KK NULL.about:
Extropy: A Sonic Manifesto of the Posthuman Future



The album’s title, Extropy, evokes a vision of life’s resistance to decay, a counterforce to entropy through intelligence, order, and self-directed progress. This concept manifests in the music itself: rather than succumbing to randomness, the soundscapes feel meticulously sculpted, as if each burst of noise, each fractured rhythm, and each tectonic drone were engineered to defy dissolution.



From the opening track, KK NULL establishes a sonic environment that is simultaneously mechanistic and organic, as if the listener is being uploaded into a sentient machine. The interplay of microtonal oscillations and seismic pulses suggests an alien intelligence at work, constantly shifting between structure and chaos. Tracks unfold like complex systems—cybernetic networks of sound, where harsh noise walls collide with moments of eerie stillness, only to be dismantled and rebuilt in an endless cycle of deconstruction and reinvention.



One of the album’s defining features is its dynamic range. While many noise artists opt for relentless intensity, KK NULL masterfully manipulates tension, allowing silence and space to become integral components of his compositions. The deep, rumbling frequencies evoke cosmic processes—gravitational waves rippling through spacetime—while high-frequency glitches resemble the flickering signals of an interstellar transmission. At times, Extropy feels less like an album and more like a raw data stream from a posthuman civilization.



Yet, beneath the cold precision of its sonic architecture, there is an undeniable sense of organic movement. The textures morph and evolve, never repeating in quite the same way, reflecting the album’s thematic core: the continuous ascent of intelligence against the pull of disorder. The result is a work that challenges the listener not just intellectually, but physically—a visceral experience that engages the body as much as the mind.



Extropy is not merely an album; it is a philosophical statement in sound, an argument for expansion rather than decay, for self-directed evolution rather than entropy. KK NULL continues to operate at the cutting edge of experimental music, proving that even in a world increasingly saturated with noise, there are still uncharted territories of sound waiting to be explored.





『Extropy』: ポストヒューマン時代の音響マニフェスト



アルバムのタイトル『Extropy』は、生命が崩壊に抗うビジョンを想起させる。知性、秩序、そして自己主導の進化によってエントロピーに対抗する力。このコンセプトは音楽そのものにも現れている。無作為に陥るのではなく、サウンドスケープは精密に彫刻されたかのように感じられる。ノイズの爆発、断片化されたリズム、そして大地を揺るがすようなドローンの一つひとつが、崩壊への抵抗を意図して設計されているかのようだ。



オープニングトラックから、KK NULL は機械的でありながら有機的でもある音響環境を確立する。まるで聴き手が自意識を持つ機械にアップロードされていくかのように。微分音の振動と地殻変動のような脈動の相互作用は、異質な知性の働きを示唆し、構造と混沌の狭間を絶えず揺れ動く。楽曲は複雑なシステムのように展開し、サイバネティックな音のネットワークが築かれる。苛烈なノイズの壁が不気味な静寂と衝突し、解体と再構築の果てしないサイクルの中で常に生まれ変わり続けるのだ。



このアルバムの際立った特徴のひとつは、そのダイナミックレンジにある。多くのノイズアーティストが容赦のない激しさを選択する中、KK NULL は緊張感を巧みに操り、沈黙や空間を楽曲の不可欠な要素として組み込んでいる。深く唸るような低周波は宇宙的なプロセス——時空を波打つ重力波——を想起させる一方、高周波のグリッチは星間通信の点滅する信号のように響く。時に『Extropy』は単なるアルバムというより、ポストヒューマン文明から送られてくる生のデータストリームのように感じられる。



しかし、その冷徹な音響構造の精密さの下には、否応なく有機的な動きの感覚が息づいている。音のテクスチャーは変容し、進化し、決して同じ形を繰り返すことはない。それはアルバムの核心的テーマ——無秩序に抗いながら知性が絶えず上昇していく運動——を反映している。その結果生まれるのは、聴き手に知的な挑戦を投げかけるだけでなく、肉体的にも訴えかける、知性と同時に身体をも揺さぶる、生々しい体験となる作品だ。



『Extropy』は単なるアルバムではなく、音による哲学的な声明であり、崩壊ではなく拡張、エントロピーではなく自己主導の進化を唱えるひとつの主張である。KK NULL は実験音楽の最前線で活動を続け、ノイズに満ちた現代においても、まだ探査されていない音の領域が残されていることを証明し続けている。
KK NULL.credits:
released January 8, 2009
            
            Recorded & produced @ prima natura studio, 2007-2009 by Kazuyuki Kishino, including field recordings @ Stradbroke Island, Sheoak Falls, Great Otway NP in Australia, and live performance @ L'Embobineuse, Marseille, France on March 10, 2009.



Cover artwork by Seldon Hunt.

KK NULL.title: A Page Of Madness
KK NULL.about:
A Page of Madness – KK NULL’s Sonic Descent into the Mind



Among the great silent films of early Japanese cinema, A Page of Madness (1926) by Teinosuke Kinugasa stands as a landmark of avant-garde experimentation. Its fragmented, hallucinatory narrative—set within the confines of an asylum—was decades ahead of its time, rejecting intertitles and relying entirely on its disorienting visuals and frenetic editing to convey its nightmarish psychological descent. KK NULL’s 2009-2010 soundtrack for this film, commissioned by Buda Arts Centre in Belgium, is a work of equally uncompromising vision.



From the very first sounds, A Page of Madness plunges the listener into a dense sonic landscape of shifting textures, mechanical pulses, and ghostly resonances. Rather than merely accompanying the film, KK NULL’s composition acts as an extension of its themes—madness, isolation, and fractured perception. The soundtrack is not a conventional film score but an immersive experience that mirrors the film’s chaotic energy, layering complex frequencies and sonic disturbances in a way that reflects the characters’ distorted realities.



The album’s structure moves through moments of near silence, sudden eruptions of noise, and spectral harmonics, creating an atmosphere of relentless tension. There is a mechanical precision to the sound design, yet it feels deeply organic—like the inner workings of a mind unraveling. Throughout, KK NULL’s signature approach to noise and electroacoustic manipulation transforms the film’s silent imagery into a sonic fever dream.



What makes this soundtrack particularly striking is its ability to stand alone as an independent listening experience. Even without the film’s visuals, it conjures its own mental cinema, an auditory hallucination that distorts time and space. The music does not guide the audience—it unsettles, disorients, and engulfs, much like A Page of Madness itself.



KK NULL’s A Page of Madness is a masterwork of abstract sound, one that not only pays homage to Kinugasa’s visionary film but also expands upon its psychological depth. This is a soundtrack that does not merely accompany madness—it becomes it.





狂気の音世界 – KK NULL『A Page of Madness』



日本映画史における最も革新的なサイレント映画のひとつ、衣笠貞之助監督の『狂った一頁』（1926年）。その断片的かつ幻覚的な物語は、精神病院を舞台に、字幕なしで映像と編集の狂気的なリズムによって観客を圧倒する。2009年、ベルギー・コルトレイクのBuda Arts Centreの委嘱により制作されたKK NULLのサウンドトラックは、この映画と同様に妥協のない芸術的アプローチをとる。



アルバムの冒頭から、リスナーは錯綜する音響の迷宮へと引き込まれる。機械的なパルス、幽玄な残響、そして断片的なノイズが交錯し、映画の映像と共鳴するように混沌を形成する。このサウンドトラックは単なる伴奏ではなく、狂気、孤独、そして断裂した知覚を音として表現するものである。



静寂と爆発的なノイズが交互に訪れ、絶え間ない緊張感が持続する。そのサウンドデザインには機械のような精密さがありながらも、有機的で不安定な感触が共存している。まるで精神の崩壊そのものが音になったかのように、KK NULL特有のノイズと電子音響操作が映画の無声映像を音の悪夢へと変貌させる。



このサウンドトラックが特筆すべきなのは、映画を観ずとも単独の音響作品として成立している点である。リスナーは視覚的イメージを持たずとも、音による幻覚を体験し、時間と空間の歪みの中へと誘われる。音楽は鑑賞者を導くのではなく、攪乱し、飲み込み、方向感覚を奪う。それはまさに『狂った一頁』の精神性そのものと言える。



KK NULLの『A Page of Madness』は、抽象音楽の傑作であり、衣笠貞之助の映画へのオマージュであると同時に、その心理的深淵をさらに押し広げる作品である。これは狂気を伴奏する音楽ではなく、狂気そのものとなる音楽なのだ。
KK NULL.credits:
released April 27, 2017
            
            Composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima nature studio in 2009 - 2010.

KK NULL.about:
Vulcanoid - Eruptive Energy, Cosmic Turbulence



Vulcanoid is an electrifying journey into the volatile depths of sound, a seismic exploration that mirrors the chaotic yet structured forces of a planetary eruption. The album surges with relentless energy, evoking images of molten landscapes, gravitational disturbances, and cosmic turbulence.



The opening moments establish an immediate sense of pressure, as layers of dynamic textures accumulate like tectonic plates grinding against one another. Subterranean rumbles and piercing frequencies create an overwhelming sensation of instability, immersing the listener in a world where the boundaries between organic and synthetic sound blur. Unlike mere noise for its own sake, Vulcanoid exhibits a meticulous sense of structure—its eruptions are not random but guided by an internal logic that suggests an unseen yet undeniable force at work.



KK NULL’s mastery lies in his ability to craft soundscapes that feel both mechanical and primordial. The oscillating drones and pulsating distortions mimic the behaviors of natural forces—like a volcanic tremor that simultaneously destroys and reshapes the land. As the album progresses, waves of sonic intensity rise and recede, forming patterns that recall astrophysical phenomena: asteroid collisions, plasma discharges, and planetary fragmentation.



By the time Vulcanoid reaches its climax, the listener is left engulfed in a whirlwind of cascading frequencies and deep-space resonance. This is not merely an album to be heard; it is an elemental experience, an immersion into the raw mechanics of destruction and creation.



KK NULL continues to push the limits of sonic expression, and Vulcanoid stands as a testament to his enduring vision—one that fuses the geological with the astronomical, the mechanical with the chaotic, and the noise with the sublime.



噴火するエネルギー、宇宙の乱流



KK NULLのVulcanoidは、爆発的な音の深淵に飛び込む衝撃的な旅であり、惑星規模の噴火を思わせるカオスと秩序の共存を探求する作品である。このアルバムは、マグマのように激しくうねり、重力のゆらぎや宇宙の乱流を音で描き出す。



冒頭から圧倒的な緊張感が支配する。地殻変動のように音が層を成し、圧縮され、突如として爆発する。地下から響くような重低音と鋭く突き刺さる高周波が交錯し、聴く者を不安定な空間へと引きずり込む。しかし、Vulcanoidは単なる無秩序なノイズではない。その爆発には見えざる論理が潜み、混沌の中にも独自の構造がある。



KK NULLの真骨頂は、機械的でありながらも原始的な響きを持つサウンドスケープを生み出すことにある。振動するドローンや脈打つディストーションは、まるで自然界の力学を模倣するかのようだ。それは火山活動のように破壊と再生を繰り返し、やがて星間衝突やプラズマ放出、惑星の崩壊といった宇宙的スケールの現象を想起させる。



アルバムのクライマックスを迎える頃には、聴き手は音の奔流に完全に包み込まれ、深宇宙の共鳴の中に溶け込んでいく。これは単に「聴く」音楽ではない。根源的な力の発露に身を委ねる体験なのだ。



KK NULLは今もなお、音の表現の限界を押し広げ続けている。Vulcanoidは、そのビジョンを証明する作品であり、地質学的な力と宇宙的な混沌、機械とノイズ、破壊と創造の狭間に生まれた壮絶なサウンドアートである。





All music composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio.
KK NULL.credits: released August 8, 2013

KK NULL.title: Edging
KK NULL.about:
Edging is a sonic architecture of tension and release, an electrifying composition that mirrors the physicality of contemporary dance with razor-sharp precision. Created as a soundtrack for Guillaume Marie’s dance theatre piece, the album operates at the intersection of movement and sound, capturing the kinetic energy of bodies in motion through layers of pulsating frequencies, fractured rhythms, and deep, resonant drones. KK NULL’s sound design is at once intricate and visceral, shaping an immersive auditory space where time seems elastic, stretching between anticipation and impact.



The piece thrives on contrast—glacial electronic hums collide with seismic bursts of noise, while sudden voids of silence amplify the surrounding turbulence. This dynamic interplay creates an experience that is not just heard but felt, a vibrational dialogue between music and the body. Edging is an essential listen for those who seek sound as a visceral force—one that unsettles, captivates, and transforms.





Edging は緊張と解放の音響構築であり、コンテンポラリーダンスのフィジカリティを鋭敏に映し出す電撃的なコンポジションである。ギヨーム・マリーのダンスシアターピースのために作曲された本作は、運動と音の交差点に存在し、脈動する周波数、断片化されたリズム、深く共鳴するドローンによって、身体が放つエネルギーを見事に音像化している。KK NULL の音響デザインは、緻密でありながらも生々しく、時間を伸縮させるような没入的な音響空間を創出している。



氷のように冷たい電子音が地殻変動のようなノイズの爆発と衝突し、突如訪れる沈黙がその周囲の混沌をさらに際立たせる。このダイナミックなコントラストが、聴覚のみならず身体全体で感じる音の体験を生み出すのだ。Edging は、音を純粋な振動として受け取り、心身を揺さぶるような感覚を求めるリスナーにとって必聴の作品である。
KK NULL.credits:
released April 28, 2017
            
            Soundtrack for dance theatre piece “Edging” (choreographed by Guillaume Marie/TAZCORP). It was premiered at Festival les Inaccoutumés in Paris on the 19th & 20th November 2013.

Composed and produced by Kazuyuki Kishino @ prima natura studio in 2011 - 2013.

KK NULL.title: Extropy Zero One
KK NULL.about: Second output from the "EXTROPY" series that is designed to record & show the development & progress of NULL's music in both studio work and live performance. Composed & produced in NULL's home studio "prima natura" and performed live in Hamburg, Germany in November 2010. Dynamic, intense, organic & cosmic in every sense.
KK NULL.credits: released February 1, 2011
